description.narrative: Since 2007, Oxfam has been working on improving rice production techniques in Vietnam. This support is now part of the Access to Innovation and Market (AIM) project , which has been implemented in three northern provinces of Thai Nguyen, Phu Tho and Yen Bai. The goal of the project is to empower small-scale farmer men and women having increasing voice and access to livelihood options acrossthe rice value chain. In Vietnam, the AIM is currently implementing activities in three areas that designed by the previous project(Farmer Led Agriculture Innovation for Resilience (FLAIR)). First, encouraging greater support at both the provincial and national level for scaling up the system of rice intensification (SRI), a low water, agro-ecological method aimedat increasing the yield of rice. Secondly, promoting innovation among small-scale farmers. While many farmers have innovative ideas on how to improve production techniques, successful models are often not identified, recognised or promoted by local governments. Thirdly, Oxfam is improving the quality of extension services at provincial and local levels to be more responsive to the needs and interests of small-scale farmers and support farmer innovation. In FY 17, the project will focus on developing aPublic Private Partner ship (PPP) model on localrice value chain in Thai Nguyen province. This intervention aims to develop a successful model on PPP for local rice value chain development that can be adopted by public and private sectors as a right solution to benefit smallholders, especially ethnic minorities and women farmers involving in the rice value chain. .

participating-org.narrative: In Vietnam , Oxfam is one of the leading international, non -governmental organisation. Since 1955, Oxfam is active in Vietnam withhumanitarian interventions and started development work in the late 1980's. Today, Oxfam works in 26 provinces with people, governments and civil society to promote equality and well-being through social and economic change.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood
